author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Music Muster to draw local visitation to Adelaide River this weekend - Travelandtourworld.comTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Music Muster to draw local visitation to Adelaide River this weekend Published on : Thursday, July 16, 2015
Adelaide River will rock on this coming weekend. It’s the fourth year of the Adelaide River Music Muster which focuses on local music and dance acts.
“The Muster continues to grow and it should be another great event at Mount Bundy Station this year,” Arts and Museums Minister Gary Higgins said.
“The Northern Territory Government provided $8200 towards the Muster which will help cover local artists’ accommodation costs and payment for the local crew on site.”
Member for Goyder Kezia Purick said the Muster was a must-do for locals and a great occasion for visitors.
“Every year the Muster has had some wonderful entertainment and it’s a terrific time for all who attend,” Ms Purick said.
“As well as great music, there will be a ute muster and I encourage all ute lovers to be part of it for some good cash prizes.
“Everyone should get along to the Muster and experience a real Territorian good time.”
This year the Muster’s line-up includes Australian country songstress Beccy Cole, rockers The Radiators, blues/soul artist Shaun Kirk and professional stockman and country singer Dallas Steele and band.
Tickets are available online or over the counter at Mount Bundy Station, Sound of Music (Casuarina), Delaneys Country and Western Store (Darwin), News Xpress (Palmerston), Saddle World (Coolalinga), Kings Cash (Humpty Doo), Butterfly Farm (Batchelor) and the Adelaide River Post Office.
